description:
《BBC英音模仿秀》是沪江社团的原创口语社刊，主持人对音频进行重点讲解和示范模仿，并对大家递交的口语模仿作品进行一对一的点评哦！

今日主持人：苏殷歉

10秒音频：

模仿文本：

Well, in the "dead" camp, I love M. F. K. Fisher. She's funny and sarcastic, and she really does take you into the flavours of things and they, it feels, become metaphors for emotion.过去的那些作家里，我比较喜欢M. F. K. Fisher。她又风趣又毒舌，真的能带你领略食材的各种味道，还能用味道来隐喻不同的情感。

重点单词发音讲解： 

sarcastic

metaphor

快来模仿秀现场一试身手吧>> 可以得到主持人专业的点评哦！

title: BBC模仿秀: 美食作家

description:
But we're gonna start with athletics because the world governing body, the IAAF has strongly denied reports of widespread doping in the sport. In a statement they described the allegations made in reports by the Sunday Times newspaper, and the German broadcast ARD as sensationalist and confusing, saying there was no evidence any athletes had failed a drug test.

"They accept that drug abuse is a serious issue in athletics and sport as a whole, but they're defiant in their stance that they're not running away from it, they're not hiding any evidence. And they say that their detection methods and their race of success match those of any other sporting body around the world. They say more athletes have been banned for cheating by the IAAF than all other sports federations and national anti-doping agencies put together. The data used by the Sunday Times and the German broadcaster ARD, they say, was not secret. The IAAF point out that four years ago they published a similar study showing that on average 14% of athletes were doping with a level as high as 48% in some country. Some of the analysis produced by the investigation in the Sunday Times, they say, is outdated, that it relates to blood values from as long as 14 years ago. And there's an extensive response to one particular allegation that the IAAF ignore suspicious results in particular races."
